post_title: Where can I get high-end shoes/boots for men in Stockholm?

comments.author: DrGUHO
comments.body:
Morjas and Myrqvists are probably the best bang for the buckfor dressier shoes in Stockholm. 

But if you want to buy/try others brand I would advise you to visit both BÃ¤ckmans Skoservice and NK, since they both have a pretty broad selection of higher end shoes and boots (such as Loake, Crockett and Jones, Carmina, church's, Redwing, RM Williams).

comments.author: JennyDarukat
comments.body:
Depending on what kind of styles you're looking for, [Sko-Uno](https://sko-uno.com/) (western styles, doc marten & co), [Skobaren](https://skobaren.com/) (sneakers, loafers, hiking & semi-dressy boots) & [Red Wing Shoes](https://www.redwingstockholm.com/) sell great stuff, though I don't know if you'd consider any of them "high-end", depending on what kind of a person you are.

For full-on shiny dress shoes, I don't have experience but Red Wing's [Beckman line](https://www.redwingstockholm.com/c/men/beckman) has a very sleek and slim cut while still being tough and well made so that would be my first recommendation for what you wrote without knowing anything more. They're too narrow for me personally, but that seems to be a common feature of traditionally dressy styles together with a very pointy silhouette.

comments.body: And I'd recommend Rusta for clothes, and Biltema for food (& clothes)!
